instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-2662: What is 820-2662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid spilled around <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>, Green light no power
threads.message:
having a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. minor spilled on <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>, specifically, just around <CAPACITOR>C7524</CAPACITOR> <CAPACITOR>C7564</CAPACITOR>

so i replaced those and <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> as well.

<CHIP>U7501</CHIP>

PIN2 0
PIN23 12.54
PIN29 close to 5
pin 22 13   close to 2

pin 12 smc _en_pm g2 3.3v
pin 4 pin 21 close to 3.3

everything looks good,but no pp3v3 s5 output , any help please

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid spilled around <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>, Green light no power
